conclusion: Analyze the flow path of the liquid from points A, B, and C to determine which container it will flow into.
The liquid flows from points A, B, and C directed by arrows indicating the direction of movement.
Baffles are positioned to direct the flow of the liquid and are angled to guide the liquid towards a specific container.
From point A, the liquid flows towards the left side of the image.
From point B, the liquid flows towards the center of the image.
From point C, the liquid flows towards the right side of the image.
Container D is located on the left side of the image.
Container E is located on the right side of the image.
The liquid from point A will flow into container D.
The liquid from point B will flow into container E.
The liquid from point C will flow into container E.
The liquid from points A, B, and C will flow into containers D and E, with the majority flowing into container E.
